content:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About Us

	We are seeking a Front Desk/Receptionist with 2 - 5 Years experience to join our team in Lagos.

	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.

title: Fleet Officer Job at White Soul Group
content:
White Soul Group is a leading provider of logistics solutions and vehicle sales and after-sales services, dedicated to delivering excellence in every aspect of our business. With a commitment to innovation, integrity, and customer satisfaction, we strive to exceed expectations and become your trusted partner in logistics and automobile needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer

Job Location: Cross River 
Employment Type: Full-time

Duties and Responsibilities
Operations
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Mange loading and scheduling of loads
	Follow up with drivers for prompt delivery and return
	Manage diesel allocation for accuracy
	Confirm every delivery immediately after offloading to prevent losses and escalate every underdelivery

N150,000 - N200,000 / month.

title: Internal Control Officer Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Financial Control
Reports To: Head of Financial Control

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are hiring a smart, detail-oriented Internal Control Officer with 6 months to 1 year of experience in accounting or finance.
	The role involves supporting the internal control team to ensure compliance with policies, accurate financial records, and effective risk management.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor daily transactions for accuracy and compliance
	Assist in identifying control gaps and process improvements
	Support implementation of audit findings and internal reviews
	Help maintain proper records and audit documentation
	Collaborate with teams to ensure control standards are followed


Requirements


	BSc in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	6 months – 1 year of experience in accounting, audit, or internal control
	Strong Excel skills and basic understanding of internal controls
	Attention to detail and good communication skills
	High integrity and eagerness to learn.


Salary
N150,000/month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the "Internal Control Officer" as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Assistant Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited
content:
Resource Intermediaries Limited is a distinguished HR Outsourcing and Consulting firm, specializing in customized recruitment solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of companies. Our proficiency extends across a wide spectrum of positions, ranging from top-tier executives to entry-level positions, covering technical, contractual, semi-skilled, and unskilled roles. Additionally, we are recognized experts in providing a range of services including Fumigation Services, Janitorial Services, Payroll Administration, Expatriate Management, Manpower Planning, Executive Training, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Supply Chain

Position Summary


	Provides high-level executive support to senior leadership with a strong emphasis on digital coordination, advanced IT proficiency, and professional discretion.
	This role demands a tech-savvy individual capable of managing complex schedules, handling confidential communications, and executing administrative tasks using modern business technologies with accuracy, speed, and intelligence.


Core Responsibilities


	Manage executive calendars, coordinate high-level meetings, and set reminders using digital planning tools(e.g., Outlook, Teams, Google Calendar).
	Prepare well-structured PowerPoint presentations, dashboards (Power BI), reports, and business documentation.
	Draft, edit, and manage internal and external communications using professional email tools and collaborative platforms.
	Manage expense reports, petty cash reconciliation, and invoice submissions using Excel and accounting platforms.
	Oversee meeting coordination, agenda preparation, and virtual meeting setup using Zoom, Teams, or Google Meet.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, accommodation, and logistics using online booking systems.
	Implement and maintain a digital filing and document retrieval system for efficient office organization.
	Serve as the executive liaison across departments, ensuring prompt IT-enabled task execution.
	Protect highly confidential information with discretion, demonstrating ethical IT practices in data handling.


Minimum Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or any relevant field from a recognized institution.
	1+ year of experience in an administrative or executive support role (or a strong internship background).
	Demonstrated IT proficiency is non-negotiable.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite—Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
	Familiarity with Power BI, virtual meeting software, and cloud-based file management systems.
	Strong writing and verbal communication abilities with a professional tone.
	Excellent time management, multitasking, and organizational skills.
	High attention to detail and capacity to operate independently under minimal supervision.


Preferred Candidate Profile:


	Female candidate preferred, in line with internal role balancing considerations.
	Strong interpersonal presence with an ability to manage tasks diplomatically.
	Eager to grow within a fast-paced, digitally inclined business environment.
	Exhibits initiative, emotional intelligence, and solution-oriented thinking.


Monthly Net Salary
N200,000 (Net) / month.

title: Job Vacancies at The Borough Lagos
content:
The Borough Lagos - Nestled in the heart of Lagos, our boutique hotel offers unparalleled luxury and service. Whether you’re in Lagos working, relocating or traveling with your family, our boutique hotel will delight you with plush amenities with upscale décor. The Borough Lagos is already the trusted choice for the world’s leading corporations, international organizations, and discerning private clients who want to relax in the stylish comfort and feel of their own home while on a long or short stay in the Lagos area.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Floor Manager

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full Time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	We are seeking to hire a proactive, organized, and customer-focused floor manager to oversee daily operations on the floor, ensure excellent customer service, and support team performance.
	The Floor Manager will supervise staff, resolve issues efficiently, and help drive sales and excellent service.


Responsibilities


	Supervise daily floor operations to ensure smooth and efficient performance.
	Address and resolve customer complaints and inquiries professionally.
	Monitor inventory levels and communicate with stock or inventory teams.
	Assist in scheduling, delegating tasks, and ensuring shift coverage.
	Maintain cleanliness, organization, and visual standards on the floor.
	Ensure adherence to company policies, safety procedures, and operational guidelines.
	Prepare shift reports and provide input on staff evaluations.


Requirements


	Proven experience in a supervisory or floor management role 
	Strong leadership and excellent interpersonal skills.
	Ability to think quickly, troubleshoot issues, and make sound decisions
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
	Attention to details, ensuring standards are met, from cleanliness to service quality.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Kitchen Manager

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full Time

Job Description


	We are looking to hire an experienced chef to oversee the day-to-day operations of our kitchen.
	The ideal candidate will ensure food quality, manage kitchen staff, maintain hygiene standards, lead stock counts, and control food costs while delivering a safe and productive work environment. 


Responsibilities


	Coordinate kitchen staff and organize the production and preparation of food.
	Ensure all dishes are prepared according to recipes, presentation standards, and safety guidelines.
	Manage kitchen budgets, including labor costs, food costs, and waste reduction.
	Handle equipment maintenance and cleanliness of all kitchen areas.
	Monitor inventory levels and place orders to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Assist in menu development, costing, and seasonal updates with the head chef or executive chef.
	Work closely with both team members and other staff members to ensure smooth service.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a kitchen manager, sous chef, or similar role.
	In-depth understanding of food safety practices and kitchen operations.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Knowledge of different cooking techniques and cuisines.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Waitress

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Job type: Full Time

Job Brief


	We are looking for a skilled Waitress to take orders and deliver food and beverages to our customers.
	The right waitress uplifts the dining experience for customers. We are looking for someone who will have the patience, personality, and perseverance to thrive in this role.
	Waitress responsibilities include greeting and serving customers, providing detailed information on menus, multi-tasking various front-of-the-house duties, and collecting the bill. If you are able to perform well in fast-paced environments, we’d like to meet you.


Responsibilities


	Greet and escort customers to their tables
	Present menu and provide detailed information when asked (e.g. about portions, ingredients or potential food allergies)
	Prepare tables by setting up linens, silverware and glasses
	Take accurate food and drink orders using POS ordering software, order  slips or by memorising
	Communicate order details to the Kitchen Staff
	Serve food and drink orders 
	Inform customers about the day’s specials 
	Offer menu recommendations upon request
	Up-sell additional products when appropriate
	Arrange table settings and maintain a tidy dining area 
	Deliver checks and collect bill payments
	Carry dirty plates, glasses and silverware to kitchen for cleaning
	Follow all relevant health department regulations 
	Provide excellent customer service to guests 


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 2 years of waitressing experience 
	Basic math skills
	Attentiveness and patience for customers
	Excellent presentation skills
	Strong organisational and multitasking skills, with the ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment
	Active listening and effective communication skills
	Team spirit
	Flexibility to work in shifts
	High school diploma; food safety training is a plus
